posts.name: Imri Segev
posts.cooked:
For the past few months we‚Äôve been working on our first off-season project - a differential swerve for the upcoming 2024 season! Due to the recent rule changes, we decided to stop working on the mechanism for now and release our design.

M1574 - 2023 - DS - A000 ButGood (1) 1600√ó900 32.1 KB

M1574 - 2023 - DS - A000 ButGood (1) 1600√ó900 32.1 KB

M1574 - 2023 - DS - A000 ButGood (1) 1600√ó900 32.1 KB

Our first prototype:

After a few seasons with our custom swerve drive we decided to increase our top speed and acceleration by using a differential swerve as opposed to a 3 motor swerve drive because of the extra cost and weight it adds.

Module Summary: Dimensions: 188 mm x 188 mm x 192 mm (7.4‚Äù x 7.4‚Äù x 7.5‚Äù) (LxWxH) Drive Ratio: 5.3:1 Motors: x2 Falcon 500 Wheel Size: 4" Weight: 3.2 kg (7 lbs)

Drivetrain Summary: Simulated Speed: 6.5 m/s (21.2 ft/s) Number of modules: 4 Dimensions: 687.7 mm x 687.7 mm x 192 mm ( 26.7‚Äù x 26.7‚Äù x 7.5‚Äù) (LxWxH) Weight: 14.6 kg (32 lbs)

3 519√ó682 120 KB To get our differential as compact as possible we use a planetary gearbox where one motor controls the sun gear and the other the ring gear. The drive wheel is connected to one of the planet gears using a bevel while the rotation of the wheel is controlled by the rotation of the planet gears carrier. Even though this transfer can be accomplished using one planet gear we decided to use 4 to split the load across all 4 of them.

3 519√ó682 120 KB

3 519√ó682 120 KB

4 535√ó549 168 KB

4 535√ó549 168 KB

4 535√ó549 168 KB

To accurately know the angle of the wheel we use a rev absolute encoder and decided to place it at the top of the module to make sure this encoder can be swapped easily. To be able to do that we have a ‚Öú‚Äù axle running all the way from the carrier to the encoder up top. On this axle sits the sun gear using a 10 mm bearing. (This axle is both dead and alive, so we call it a ‚Äúzombie axle‚Äù).

5 1600√ó900 38.4 KB

5 1600√ó900 38.4 KB

5 1600√ó900 38.4 KB

To be able to control the module, we needed to know the speed of each motor based on the desired Drive Velocity and Rotation Velocity.

After receiving the news that an 8 motor drive will not be possible in the 2024 season we were bummed that this project will not be carried out but we will take everything we learned from it and use it in our custom swerve drive.

Good luck to everyone moving forwards and may you have a great season!

We‚Äôll leave you with our CAD on Grabcad . If any of you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions, please feel free to leave a comment below or dm me or my team members.
Will you run it at IOS?

posts.name: Imri Segev
posts.cooked: Sadly no, but we‚Äôll have one module with us.

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
I played around with this concept back in‚Ä¶ 2019? I am so glad I get to see some form of it in the wild, even under these unfortunate circumstances. Good work.

I never thought about splitting the inner ring gear from the motor drive gear, so while this does have a height penalty it does make it much more feasible economicly and manufacturable.

Seeing the innovation in the Diff swerve community has been wild.  Swerve has mostly stagnated. It‚Äôs sad to see all these fun and wild designs go by the wayside.

Please document (and tag) the snot out of this module for the future. We all appreciate the collaborative space and the effort put in.

posts.name: Or Ben Yehuda
posts.cooked:
Skyehawk:

I never thought about splitting the inner ring gear from the motor drive gear, so while this does have a height penalty it does make it much more feasible economicly and manufacturable.

On top of splitting the ring gear from the gear driven by the motor, the ring gear itself is split into several layers so it is essentially connected to the inside of the bearing

posts.name: waialua3:59
posts.cooked: Great looking design!  Its too bad the upcoming rules wont allow for countless teams like yours to want to continue developing differential swerve.

posts.name: Lavi Arzi

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked: For crying out loud, behave everyone.
Very nice design! It still requires an internal gear. How did you manufacture it? Also, isnt the bittom driven gear a bit thin?

posts.name: Or Ben Yehuda
posts.cooked: We were going to manufacture it using a laser cutter. The gear is thin to help manufacturing but not too much.

posts.name: AgentSmith451
posts.cooked: I really like this design, sorry that you won‚Äôt be able to use it this year. I think the one change I would make is go to 3 planets instead of 4. Since you said the load can technically be carried by 1 planet, you‚Äôll still have a decent factor of safety. 3 planets allows more even load sharing than 4 assuming slightly imperfect planet carriers (think 3 legged stool vs rocking on a 4 legged chair).

posts.name: Mark Wasserman
posts.cooked: Has it been determined if a swerve with 2 wheels can have 2 motors?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Not fast swerve, but good swerve driven quickly

posts.custom_user_title: Not fast swerve, but good swerve driven quickly

posts.name: Totally out of touch
posts.cooked: The wording of the blog post just says four motors, so seems pretty likely to be legal‚Ä¶ And if not, unsure how/why they‚Äôd make two module diff swerve illegal and not somehow make skid steer illegal.

posts.name: Parker Duncan
posts.cooked: The final wording FIRST decides upon will have a huge impact on the actual cause and effect of the rule. The current wording in the blog post will unfortunately eliminate certain drive trains. This is where I have an issue with the current rule. I do believe some sorta rule is needed to limit destruction to the field but the current way they are discussing implementing it just wont work.
